Posts.Content: Hi folks, Had two cycles of chemo and the arm they give it in is really sore. It's not red or swollen but even the skin hurts and it hurts when I move it. It was slightly sore after the first cycle but it's worse this time and I've still got four to go. Mentioned it to my chemo nurse who said that it's one of those things and to take painkillers. I have another cycle in 10 days and just hope it settles as the thought of needles in that arm makes my toes curl! Had anyone had the same? Have you any tips? Thanx
Posts.Title: Arm pain ?

Posts.Content: Than for your replies. Finally went to GP who thought I had a soft tissue infection and put me on antibiotics. Hope it feels better for treatment next week! Think I may ask about getting a line put in.
Posts.Title: Arm pain ?

Posts.Content: Hi, know exactly how u feel! I too had DVT, tried a PICC line but arm became worse- swollen and a lovely blue/White colour ! Ended up being admitted. Now got Hickman line and three months of anti-coagulation but arm now fine. 10 days to my last cycle.....yippee !
Posts.Title: Being treated for DVT. Amusingly, suddenly worried about death!

Posts.Content: Thanx Helen. Nice to talk to another horse lover! Are you riding at the min? Gotta admit that I just dont wanna get on at the min and I haven't a clue why ! Hope it soon passes and it's just my head in bits! Monet = Helen......what a coincidence
Posts.Title: Headwear

Posts.Content: Hi all Hair now gone, I've got beautiful wig but spend a lot fo time with my horse so don't want to wear my wig. Has anyone tried the ready tied bandana type head gear? And can you recommend any sites/ shops where I can get them from? Thanx
Posts.Title: Headwear

Posts.Content: Thanx nellvans and Hilary will have a look at them!
